title: History of Illaoi
body:
How did Illaoi 'find' Nagakaborous?

 Why did Nagakaborous choose them, or how did Illaoi win them over to be their vessel? 

Is Nagakaborous as conscious and intelligent as Aurelion Sol and Bard?

replies.body:
1.  She was born on an island where it/she is one most important deities.
2. Not sure what you mean by this question.   them?    If you mean Illaoi-- she was raised up to the rank of Truth Bearer by her drive and actions.
3. Nagakaborous exists somewhere between the Brahman and Tiamat (the god not the D&D dragon).  Arguably it is defined by being to great to be understood by mortal minds.  


bonus:  A.Sol is a higher plane of being than Illaoi --- but he is the beetle calling the ant small.   Nagakaborous is all.

Damn thank you for this bad-ass reply...

Other Rioters said A.Sol thinks Naga is on his level, but now we know Naga is actually much higher. So... Aurelion is the one who doesn't understand, either?

It's really nice that Riot is filling out the pantheon of the world (not necessarily in playable champions)
Wait wait wait, does Sol know it and basically playing the "big fish in a small tank" or he doesn't know it?

{{champion:420}} _"We cannot comprehend the design. A raindrop cannot comprehend a river valley."_

Aurelion Sol is more like a wave in the valley, so he understands things a bit better than the drops of water.

Aurelion doesn't seem beyond comprehension like Bard and Naga.

Both Nagakaborous and Bard are described as being beyong human understanding. What is their relation in the insect terms you used? c::

> [{quoted}](name=Don Noat Amu,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=dsnsEdU2,comment-id=00020006,timestamp=2016-03-19T14:23:08.048+0000)
>
> Aurelion doesn't seem beyond comprehension like Bard and Naga.
> 
> Both Nagakaborous and Bard are described as being beyong human understanding. What is their relation in the insect terms you used? c::

Beetles are big when compared to an ant but even compared to a baby human are themselves small. In essence, Naga is so far above Sol that it is a joke that Sol feels like he has a right to look down on Illaoi.

More than a diety as "we" think they are (ala Greek gods, christian/muslim/jew god, etc.), Nagakaboros seems more a primal form of vital energy that flows into existence while having self awarness and a sort-of-will.

Considering the tentaclish appearance we might think of.. her? it? as a good version of Warcraft Old Gods.

Edit: It better be not canon that Aurelion Sol is just a beetle compared to it though >.> Life forms are born by stars matter so the reaosn Nagakaborous is flowing in the universe is **also** becuase of Aurelion.
there may be a few different primal forces and energies things originate from in this world

> [{quoted}](name=WAAARGHbobo,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=dsnsEdU2,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2016-03-18T20:53:33.093+0000)
>
> 1.  She was born on an island where it/she is one most important deities.
> 2. Not sure what you mean by this question.   them?    If you mean Illaoi-- she was raised up to the rank of Truth Bearer by her drive and actions.
> 3. Nagakaborous exists somewhere between the Brahman and Tiamat (the god not the D&D dragon).  Arguably it is defined by being to great to be understood by mortal minds.  
> 
> 
> bonus:  A.Sol is a higher plane of being than Illaoi --- but he is the beetle calling the ant small.   Nagakaborous is all.

Is Nagakaborous a real god? Like Allah of Islam or Yehova of Judaism? Or even Eru of Middle-Earth?

Well Illaoi is effectively living proof of Nagakabouros's existence, and Aurelion Sol's encountered her before, but Illaoi certainly doesn't understand her fully, and even Aurelion might not. It depends on what Nagakabouros actually _is_, though given her scope she's more likely to be a god comparatively to anything else we've seen in the lore.

> [{quoted}](name=WAAARGHbobo,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=dsnsEdU2,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2016-03-18T20:53:33.093+0000)
> bonus:  A.Sol is a higher plane of being than Illaoi --- but he is the beetle calling the ant small.   Nagakaborous is all.


Is this official, canon, lore? or just what illaoi believes it to be?

what does that make the Void?
Let's just not make Illaoi or anything related to her important. Let her be non-canon and let us all forget that joke champ.

From what we know Nagakaborous is something even greater than Aurelion or Bard.

Aurelion might be an ancient cosmic being and Bard a powerful spirit,but Nagakaborous is a god(unless Illaoi is misinformed),she is everywhere and nowhere at the same time.

I doubt that she chose illaoi,it is more that illaoi learned how to channel  a part of the power of nagakaborous to use it against her enemies.

Illaoi is pretty much like the typical priest or cleric from a fantasy game,only that she is really buff and that her god is full of tentacles.
A.Sol taunts Illaoi by saying "You don't understand your god, Illaoi". Though Illaoi herself seems confident in her own understanding. It's very interesting.

Well Illaoi's beliefs are born from the cultural and religious practices of Buhru, so it's effectively the Buhrun interpretation of Nagakabouros. What they understand about the mighty being is relative to how she interacts with Runeterra and how they've come to know her power. I
More importantly, who would name something nagakabourous? Sounds like some kind of weird island name. I'm actually surprised the voice actor could say that xdd
Actually Riot originally used the name nagakaborous just as a placeholder,but they liked the way Illaois voice actress said that name so much that they kept it anyway.

Indeed, and now that word exists in the Buhrun language and it means:

"The unending monster that drives the sea and sky."

Names are complicated.
